metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1735 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 3.24.35.33, as used in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.131 on Windows and OS X and before 34.0.1847.132 on Linux, allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-browser-l10n - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-chromedriver - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
